programme.title: Calvary
programme.desc: A priest in a rural Irish village receives a confession from a man who vows to kill him in one week as punishment for the Catholic Church's history of child abuse. The cleric spends his last seven days trying to put his community's affairs in order, but finds himself surrounded by people who harbour resentments of their own against the Church. Drama, starring Brendan Gleeson, Chris O'Dowd, Kelly Reilly, Aidan Gillen and Dylan Moran.

programme.title: Ray
programme.desc: Biopic of soul singer Ray Charles, exploring his battle against racial bigotry, drug addiction and personal demons on his rise to stardom. Blind by the time he was seven, the musician flirted with several styles including gospel, jazz and country, and became known as one of the music industry's most innovative performers. Starring an Oscar-winning Jamie Foxx alongside Regina King and Kerry Washington.(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: Artist Gerda Wegener unveils a portrait of her husband Einar dressed as a woman in 1920s Copenhagen. Einar realises that the woman in the painting is his true identity, and decides to become one of the first people to undergo sex reassignment surgery. Period drama based on David Ebershoff's novel inspired by the true story of artist Lili Elbe, starring Eddie Redmayne and an Oscar-winning Alicia Vikander.(n)

programme.title: Cries and Whispers
programme.desc: Agnes, a woman dying of cancer, is visited in her remote home by her two sisters. Far from offering comfort, their arrival brings long-buried family conflicts bubbling to the surface, with tensions rising as Agnes' health deteriorates. Ingmar Bergman's drama, starring Harriet Andersson, Liv Ullmann and Ingrid Thulin. In Swedish.(n)

programme.title: A Star Is Born
programme.desc: Following a gig, fading music star Jackson Maine happens upon Ally, a nightclub singer-songwriter. Their instant chemistry leads to a tempestuous romance as he helps her on the road to stardom. However, Jackson's alcoholism has explosive repercussions as her career blossoms. Oscar-winning drama, starring Lady Gaga, Bradley Cooper, who also directed, and Sam Elliott.(n)

programme.title: Calvary
programme.desc: A priest in a rural Irish village receives a confession from a man who vows to kill him in one week as punishment for the Catholic Church's history of child abuse. The cleric spends his last seven days trying to put his community's affairs in order, but finds himself surrounded by people who harbour resentments of their own against the Church. Drama, starring Brendan Gleeson, Chris O'Dowd, Kelly Reilly, Aidan Gillen and Dylan Moran.(n)

programme.title: The Blind Side
programme.desc: A middle-class family take in a hulking homeless teenager, who has no education or skills to speak of. The indomitable wife encourages him to turn his life around, helping him to get the grades he needs for a college scholarship and hone his sporting skills to become an American football player. Fact-based drama, starring an Oscar-winning Sandra Bullock alongside Quinton Aaron and Tim McGraw.(n)

programme.title: The Shawshank Redemption
programme.desc: A banker is wrongly jailed for his wife's murder and over the course of a life sentence he forms a close friendship with a fellow inmate. He also earns a position of trust as book-keeper to the corrupt prison governor - but makes an enemy of his benefactor as he tries to clear his name. Frank Darabont's drama, starring Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Bob Gunton, William Sadler, Clancy Brown and Gil Bellows.(n)

programme.title: Ray
programme.desc: Biopic of soul singer Ray Charles, exploring his battle against racial bigotry, drug addiction and personal demons on his rise to stardom. Blind by the time he was seven, the musician flirted with several styles including gospel, jazz and country, and became known as one of the music industry's most innovative performers. Starring an Oscar-winning Jamie Foxx alongside Regina King and Kerry Washington.(n)

programme.title: What Dreams May Come
programme.desc: The spirit of a man killed in a car crash uses his vivid imagination to create a breath-taking world - but he is unable to fully enjoy his heavenly home without his wife beside him. However, when grief drives her to suicide, she ends up in an altogether more hellish afterlife, prompting her husband to embark on a perilous mission to rescue her from the dark side. Fantasy, starring Robin Williams, Cuba Gooding Jr, Annabella Sciorra and Max von Sydow.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Sacrifice
programme.desc: American chess prodigy Bobby Fischer challenges the best player in the Soviet Union in a top championship, causing the two nations to use the event to fuel their respective agendas. Fischer soon finds himself caught between the two superpowers as well as having to deal with his own struggles. Tobey Maguire and Liev Schreiber star in this fact-based sporting drama set in 1972 during the Cold War.(n)

programme.title: Rebellious
programme.desc: A princess is kidnapped by an evil sorcerer and her scholarly fiance must use his wits in an epic quest to find her, while she boldly challenges her captors and plots a daring escape. Animated fantasy adventure, with the voices of Vanessa Johansson and Marc Thompson.(n)

programme.title: Between the Temples
programme.desc: A cantor in a crisis of faith has his world turned upside down when his school music teacher re-enters his life as his new adult bat mitzvah student. Comedy, starring Jason Schwartzman, Carol Kane and Dolly De Leon.(n)

programme.title: Omni Loop
programme.desc: A Florida woman decides to solve time travel in order to go back and be the person she always intended. Sci-fi drama, starring Mary-Louise Parker and Ayo Edebiri.(n)

programme.title: Bookworm
programme.desc: Mildred, an 11-year-old girl, finds her world turned upside down when her estranged father, a washed-up magician, takes her on a wild adventure. Family comedy, starring Elijah Wood and Nell Fisher.(n)

programme.title: Beetlejuice Beetlejuice
programme.desc: A family tragedy woos Delia Deetz, daughter Lydia and rebellious teenage granddaughter Astrid back to the close-knit community of Winter River. Astrid accidentally opens a portal to the afterlife by summoning Beetlejuice three times. The mischievous demon ricochets between realms, wreaking havoc wherever he goes. Tim Burton's comedy sequel, starring Michael Keaton, Winona Ryder and Jenna Ortega.(n)

programme.title: Cleaner
programme.desc: Environmental activists hijack an energy company's gala in Canary Wharf and take 300 hostages and an ex-soldier now working as a window cleaner tries to rescue them. Action thriller, starring Daisy Ridley. Action thriller, starring Daisy Ridley and Clive Owen.(n)

programme.title: Poison
programme.desc: Lucas and Edith reunite many years after a tragedy drove the former couple apart. Director Désirée Nosbusch's award-winning drama, starring Tim Roth and Trine Dyrholm.(n)

programme.title: Trap
programme.desc: A serial killer attempts to evade a police blockade while attending a concert with his daughter. Thriller, starring Josh Hartnett, Ariel Donoghue, Saleka Shyamalan and Hayley Mills.(n)

programme.desc: On holiday in Europe, American couple Ben and Louise Dalton and their anxiety-crippled daughter Agnes meet English doctor Patrick Feld, his wife Ciara and their young son Ant, who was born without a tongue. programme.title: Madame Web
programme.desc: Superhero action adventure starring Dakota Johnson. While on a dangerous job, New York paramedic Cassie Webb has a near-fatal accident and develops precognitive powers. When she foresees that three young women are in danger, she sets out to protect them from the super-powered villain who wants them dead.

programme.title: The Flash
programme.desc: Barry Allen uses his super speed to change the past, but his attempt to save his family creates a world without superheroes. Comic-book adventure, with Ezra Miller, Sasha Calle, Michael Keaton and Ben Affleck.

programme.title: Sweethearts
programme.desc: Two college freshmen break up with their high school sweethearts during one chaotic night before Thanksgiving. Comedy, starring Kiernan Shipka, Nico Hiraga, Christine Taylor and Jason Babinsky.

programme.title: Dangerous Waters
programme.desc: A sailing trip turns into a nightmare when a woman uncovers the dark past of her mother's new boyfriend. Thriller, starring Odeya Rush, Eric Dane, Saffron Burrows and Ray Liotta in one of his final films.

programme.title: Absolution
programme.desc: Crime drama starring Liam Neeson. An ageing career criminal and former boxer discovers he has developed a neurodegenerative disease that gives him only months to live. His flashes of memory loss at work soon cause trouble, but redemption beckons when he attempts to reconnect with his estranged daughter and grandson.

programme.title: The Cinema List: British Sky Originals
programme.desc: Not sure what to watch next? Then discover some of the greatest British Sky Originals. From Four Kids and It to SAS Red Notice, there's something here for everyone.

programme.title: Out of Darkness
programme.desc: In the Stone Age, a gang of early humans face a mystical being hellbent on hunting them down. Prehistoric horror, starring Iola Evans and Arno LÃ¼ning. The dialogue is in a specially contructed language and features subtitles.

programme.title: The Bricklayer
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Steve Vail is reactivated when an extortionist targets the agency. Director Renny Harlin's thriller based on the Noah Boyd novel, starring Aaron Eckhart, Nina Dobrev and Clifton Collins Jr.

programme.title: Absolution

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: Romantic comedy sequel starring Nia Vardalos and John Corbett. More than a decade after their marriage, Toula and Ian are going through some marital strife and problems with teenage daughter, Paris. The last thing they need is the uncovering of a family secret.

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 3
programme.desc: Following the death of her father Gus, Toula Portokalos honours his dying wish to take the entire family to his childhood village and reconnect with their Greek roots. Toula's husband Ian joins the madcap expedition along with extended family including her brother Nick and Aunt Voula. Romantic comedy, starring Nia Vardalos and John Corbett.

programme.title: 8 Mile
programme.desc: Drama starring rap artist Eminem and Kim Basinger. Jimmy "Rabbit" Smith is stuck in a dead-end factory job in a tough area of Detroit where he lives with his highly strung mother and little sister. Jimmy longs to break out of this bleak existence by making it as a rapper, but his road to stardom is going to be a rocky one.

programme.title: Bob Marley: One Love
programme.desc: Biographical music drama starring Kingsley Ben-Adir. In the late 1970s, after being shot and badly wounded on stage in Jamaica, reggae star Bob Marley decamps to the UK, where he and his band work on the album that will make him a global icon.

programme.title: The King's Speech
programme.desc: Oscar-winning historical drama starring Colin Firth, Helena Bonham Carter and Geoffrey Rush. As part of his royal duties, Prince Albert is required to speak at public events, a task made all the more difficult owing to his severe stammer. The death of his father and subsequent abdication of his older brother means that "Bertie" is to be crowned king. Unconventional speech therapist Lionel Logue is

programme.title: The Color Purple
programme.desc: Musical adaptation of Alice Walker's novel, starring Fantasia Barrino and Taraji P Henson. In early 20th-century Georgia, young Celie is forced to marry the tyrannical farmer "Mister". For years, Celie's life is bleak and difficult, but when Mister's mistress, the spirited jazz singer Shug Avery, comes to stay, Celie begins to believe in herself.

programme.title: Monkey Man
programme.desc: Action thriller directed by and starring Dev Patel. A nameless young man known only as Kid makes his living as a masked participant at a seedy underground fight club where he is beaten up regularly. But there is method in his madness, as he works toward exacting revenge against those responsible for his traumatic past.

programme.desc: A human soldier is sent from 2029 to 1984 to stop a cyborg killing machine, which has been programmed to execute a young woman whose unborn son is the key to humanity's future salvation.

programme.title: Camp Hell
programme.desc: Horrific events plague a teen when his parents send him to a Christian camp.

programme.title: Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom
programme.desc: Black Manta wields the power of the mythic Black Trident to unleash an ancient and malevolent force. Hoping to end his reign of terror, Aquaman forges an unlikely alliance with his brother to protect their kingdom and save the world from destruction.

programme.desc: An FBI trainee (Jodie Foster) seeks advice from a brilliant, psychopathic prisoner (Anthony Hopkins) to catch a killer who skins his victims.

programme.desc: A weekend getaway at a remote cabin turns to chaos when it's revealed that one of the guests -- a subservient android built for human companionship -- has gone haywire.

programme.title: We Live in Time

programme.desc: Lindbergh's increasingly popular campaign captures some in the Levin family, as well as Bengelsdorf; Alvin must decide between serving a local real estate magnate or risking an open fight with the fascist forces he sees spreading across the world.

programme.title: The Plot Against America
programme.desc: Charles Lindbergh puts Bengelsdorf in charge of a program called Just Folks; Bess places her family on a waiting list to emigrate to Canada; the Levins take a trip to Washington, D.C., where they experience anti-Semitism among citizens and police.

programme.title: The Plot Against America
programme.desc: Evelyn and Bengelsdorf receive an invitation from Mrs. Lindbergh to a state dinner for Nazi Germany's foreign minister; back from war, Alvin takes a job at his uncle's warehouse; Philip is traumatized by a death in the neighborhood.

programme.title: The Plot Against America
programme.desc: After learning the family has been selected for a forced relocation, Herman looks to make a challenge in court; Bess gives Herman an ultimatum when violence breaks out at a rally for Lindbergh's most public liberal challenger.

programme.title: The Plot Against America
programme.desc: As riots and conspiracies spread across the country in the lead up to election day, Herman takes measures to keep his family safe; Bess does all she can at a great distance to help a small child caught in a maelstrom of anti-Semitism in Kentucky.

programme.title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
programme.desc: A 19th-century martial arts master (Chow Yun-Fat) gives a sword called Green Destiny to his beloved (Michelle Yeoh), then the two must recover it from female thieves.

programme.title: Final Destination
programme.desc: Teens meet with horrible ends after a classmate's (Devon Sawa) precognitive vision leads to their ejection from a doomed airliner.

programme.title: Final Destination 2
programme.desc: Death returns to claim the lives of those who did not die in a horrible highway calamity as they were meant to do.

programme.title: Final Destination 3
programme.desc: A high-school senior (Mary Elizabeth Winstead) and her friends must deal with repercussions of cheating death when they survive a terrible roller-coaster accident.

programme.title: The Final Destination
programme.desc: A horrifying premonition saves a young man (Bobby Campo) and his friends from death during a racetrack accident, but terrible fates await them nonetheless.

programme.title: Final Destination 5
programme.desc: When a man's premonition saves them from a fatal bridge collapse, several unfortunate souls learn that Death will not be cheated.

programme.title: Evil Dead Rise
programme.desc: A reunion between two estranged sisters gets cut short by the rise of flesh-possessing demons, thrusting them into a primal battle for survival as they face the most nightmarish version of family imaginable.

programme.title: Skin Can Breathe
programme.desc: A gay teen tries to adjust to a new life after moving from Cambodia to America with his mother.

programme.title: Skin Can Breathe
programme.desc: A gay teen tries to adjust to a new life after moving from Cambodia to America with his mother.

programme.title: Red Tails
programme.desc: During World War II, the U.S. military forms the first all-black aerial-combat unit, known as the Tuskegee Airmen.

programme.title: Godzilla x Kong: The New Empire
programme.desc: Godzilla and the almighty Kong face a colossal threat hidden deep within the planet, challenging their very existence and the survival of the human race.

programme.title: Joker
programme.desc: Isolated, bullied and disregarded by society, failed comedian Arthur Fleck begins a slow descent into madness as he transforms into the criminal mastermind known as the Joker.

programme.title: Joker: Folie Ã Deux
programme.desc: Struggling with his dual identity, failed comedian Arthur Fleck stumbles upon true love while incarcerated at Arkham State Hospital. Awaiting trial for the murder of five people, Fleck soon discovers the music that's always been inside him.

programme.title: The Lionheart
programme.desc: In 2011, two-time Indianapolis 500 champion Dan Wheldon died in a horrific crash at the Las Vegas Motor Speedway, shaking the world of motorsports to its core. Ten years later, Dan's two sons, Sebastian and Oliver, follow in their father's footsteps.

programme.title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
programme.desc: Supercomputer HAL 9000 guides astronauts (Keir Dullea, Gary Lockwood, William Sylvester) on a trip to find the origins of humans.

programme.title: Meg 2: The Trench
programme.desc: Jonas Taylor leads a research team on an exploratory dive into the deepest depths of the ocean. Pitted against colossal, prehistoric sharks and relentless environmental plunderers, they must outrun, outsmart and outswim their merciless predators.

programme.title: Taylor Mac's 24-Decade History of Popular Music
programme.desc: Performance artist Taylor Mac and 24 musicians reframe American history during a 24-hour concert that features popular songs from 1776 to 2016.
A time traveler risks his life to change the course of history and save the future of humanity.

programme.title: White Chicks
programme.desc: Two male FBI agents (Shawn Wayans, Marlon Wayans) pose as female socialites to foil a kidnapping plot and save their jobs.

programme.title: Assassin's Creed
programme.desc: A descendant (Michael Fassbender) of the mysterious secret society known as the Assassins uses his newfound knowledge and physical skills to battle the power-hungry Templar Order.

programme.title: Barbie
programme.desc: Barbie and Ken are having the time of their lives in the colorful and seemingly perfect world of Barbie Land. However, when they get a chance to go to the real world, they soon discover the joys and perils of living among humans.

programme.title: Friday
programme.desc: A South Central Los Angeles resident (Ice Cube) hangs out on his front porch with a pal (Chris Tucker) who owes money to a drug dealer.

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: To avoid being beaten up, a young man (Ice Cube) goes to live with his uncle, who just won the lottery.

programme.title: Friday After Next
programme.desc: Working as security guards, Craig (Ice Cube) and Day-Day (Mike Epps) run into the thief who stole their Christmas presents.

programme.title: Goodrich
programme.desc: Andy's life gets upended when his wife enters a 90-day rehab program, leaving him in charge of their twins. With his career falling by the wayside, he soon leans on his pregnant daughter for support, ultimately becoming the father she never had.

programme.title: Elevation
programme.desc: Post-apocalyptic survivors find refuge in the Rocky Mountains to hide from giant, insect-like creatures that can't live above 8,000 feet. However, when one of them needs life-saving supplies, they risk it all to venture into the danger zone.

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: A Treasury agent (J.K. Simmons) closes in on a brilliant freelance accountant (Ben Affleck) who works for dangerous criminal organizations.

programme.title: Child's Play
programme.desc: A struggling single mother unknowingly gifts her son a doll imbued with a serial killer's consciousness.

programme.title: Child's Play
programme.desc: Young Andy receives a special present from his mom -- a seemingly innocent Buddi doll that becomes his best friend. When the doll suddenly takes on a life of its own, Andy unites with other kids to stop the sinister toy from wreaking bloody havoc.

programme.title: The Big Year
programme.desc: Three men (Steve Martin, Jack Black, Owen Wilson) race around North America in a prestigious contest to see who can spot the greatest number of bird species in a single year.

programme.title: Man of Steel
programme.desc: Though struggling with the ramifications of his extraordinary origin and abilities, young Clark Kent (Henry Cavill) must become a hero and save those he loves from a dire threat.

programme.title: Waitress: The Musical
programme.desc: Jenna Hunterson is a waitress and expert pie maker stuck in a small town and a loveless marriage. When a baking contest offers her a chance at escape, Jenna fights to reclaim part of herself.

programme.title: Uncharted
programme.desc: Treasure hunter Victor Sullivan recruits Nathan Drake to help him recover a 500-year-old fortune. What starts out as a heist becomes a globe-trotting, white-knuckle race to reach the prize before the ruthless Santiago Moncada can get his hands on it.

programme.desc: Young Furiosa gets caught in the crossfire of two tyrannical warlords. As the tyrants fight for dominance, Furiosa soon finds herself in a nonstop battle to make her way home.
